CEA9940C672749F5A6355EE8B6C117E9.description: Identify whether someone's non-verbal communication matches their verbal communication.

215EF0F2B79D4B01B2157EE6B1EB54F6.description: Talk about others' presentations, including what they enjoyed and why.

9E71E1533BD7435E90503E91786C5FBB.description: Talk about own activities, including why they made particular choices.

35F3862D80744810931F29674961EB2C.description: Deliver a short presentation in a familiar context about a chosen object or event.

DBFC765E8AC94D8CBA55A9EA2A0752FD.description: Extend experiences and ideas about characters and situations through role-play.

5D590308E1744717A73937DBE1707C6A.description: Show awareness of speech marks when reading aloud.

DB4EEF1E67BC49588901D2EC33E00E6D.description: Read familiar stories and poems aloud with fluency and expression.

D5E06E0934254E9A968AC0C0D30776F2.description: Take turns in speaking, adding relevant information.

9BA65EE6195E49C3A549BA2D5DFE8DD5.description: During a discussion, respond in a way that is relevant to the task.

64E99CBF1FC94D84B66E89DA01896A44.description: Show understanding of the opinions of others.

A6BF45FB7EE648EC99DAA793C17BFD7C.description: Work with others in a group.

6931662E1EFA43E798C9BBE4CB3D0A13.description: Ask questions about what is heard or read to improve understanding.

77A2EE02818B4A9FAC3224279B357988.description: Listen and respond appropriately, including recalling the main points.

E0E7279BFD694CAF8C2C308377E7E038.description: Show some awareness of the listener, e.g. by varying tone to engage them, by responding to their non-verbal cues.

6A233A4B3731425E84BA2E47E6E939FC.description: Show some use of non-verbal communication techniques.

28003708A6E64EEE9D068312B71A4D16.description: Use relevant vocabulary to describe events and feelings

12D09B2FE3054105B2AEAC18EC925E0B.description: Provide relevant information with sufficient detail, as needed.

B100FCE33530456C8659764B3293C661.description: Speak clearly and confidently with familiar people.

193C6AEDBBA1473C979E15E47D2EB38B.description: Begin to proofread for errors by re-reading own writing aloud (e.g. sentence punctuation, verb forms).

89412A592FB9453480631736AD583818.description: Read own writing to others and share ideas for improvements.

CEB52C9E86F54D42B6971FB4840EA282.description: Present text in a range of different ways, e.g. diagrams with typed labels, storyboards with handwritten captions.

2E6361A29D7341BBB69864C9AA3886C6.description: Record key information drawn from a non-fiction text, e.g. listing key topic words

478FCE00913A4360A3E3A51BFE9E64E8.description: Know how to join letters and which letters are best left unjoined.

79ABABCDE96D4A73BB44E92C3E12D9A4.description: Ensure consistency in formation, size and proportion of letters and the spacing of words.

0CC3507FB4EB4374A7062BD2940793A0.description: Include additional information to develop some ideas when writing non-fiction texts.

574988C40359476388C96E96A2C63307.description: Begin to write for a purpose using basic language and features appropriate for the text type.

0E52701D7B484AB9B18306C5FC197953.description: Include simple descriptions of settings and characters when writing stories.

08134CDEB62C42F3A590E5A863707E97.description: Plan writing through discussion, e.g. talking about the setting and characters before writing a story.

8D4A7D60E1B64BC8B037D694E612D959.description: Begin to write simple stories and poems, including using the structures of familiar stories and poems.

DC9F712B32F34A7E845FCBECD84D651F.description:
3 Use simple organisational features appropriate to the text type,
e.g. subheadings, labelled diagrams.

2D7DE9A78F954A8BA335A080DB24446C.description: Group together sentences relating to similar ideas.

54FF077493434DDE940081DB4FB827AB.description:
Write a sequence of events or ideas, including stories with a
beginning, middle and end.

9CCC65FBC61049A28932A33DA14427A1.description: Use common adjectives appropriately in sentences, including simple comparative and superlative forms.

7AC9495412AC440AA2C3D5A271CC1625.description: Use pronouns in writing, and ensure grammatical agreement of nouns and pronouns with verbs.

E3397B1DD8BF42F79EFFBCD99951F5AB.description: Use simple quantifiers appropriately for the context, e.g. some, most, all.

7669746A73DA479693232B83962BC066.description: Begin to use suffixes -s, -ing and -ed appropriately for present and past verb forms in sentences

67885518EBEF43DDAF442E710557952A.description: Begin to write multi-clause sentences using simple connectives,e.g. because, if, when.

B3C41C43560D45DFB3B841155DBB9943.description: Write simple sentences, and multi-clause sentences using and, but, or.

57EF5D1A874A43AFBA8A27A586015586.description: Write clear statements, commands/instructions and questions.

ECF63FAFAB4149DC954C5760D3FA3B90.description:
Begin to include direct speech in writing, using a new line for each
speaker.

8E2284DDE830486EA42C2BDBC7C50310.description: Explore and use commas to separate items in lists.

FDA5D2DAD3B9495BA681EB68586AD3E3.description: Use capital letters, full stops and question marks correctly in simple sentences.

6BA00D7E44914E80B39D0F0F81A0CB56.description: Use own lists of interesting and significant words to extend the range of vocabulary used in written work.

53F088E7277A43CDB011FCACD8BFCBD7.description: Choose and use interesting words and phrases, including to describe people and places.

7541DAEB55D140F0B64ED27072E680E6.description: Begin to vary sentence openings, including using language of time, e.g. Suddenly …, That morning …

AB3F02230B4D405284FB2C83ACC1DE23.description: In story writing, use a range of adjectives to describe characters and settings.

944B2AE9C9EE4F4DBD68DB2C33536E2D.description: Use vocabulary relevant to a familiar topic.

52E0C7996F0A4B06B23B23C15D607187.description: Ask for support in spelling unfamiliar words and use spelling logs to support future writing

5DF4A91F751D4D4CB5E83318376E5DFB.description: Spell a range of common exception words accurately.

7340A5816B5A45718B89F8E2A1438605.description: Use knowledge of phonemes and spelling patterns to spell a range of common regular words correctly

83FDAB39E19445078F8579496D79E930.description: Explore and use words which sound the same but have different spellings of long vowels (homophones), e.g. tail and tale, stare and stair, blew and blue.

18BA80FF0C5F44EBA0820CC8765F3823.description: Spell some words with common prefixes and suffixes, including un-, dis-, -er, -est, -ful and -ly.

A863CAF10710479884B4A70FC2521E69.description: Explore and use verbs with endings -s, -ed and -ing where no change is needed to the root, and understand the effect on the meaning of a verb of adding these endings.

7C2F35C669C04108BEE0A3DFD9156575.description: Use common irregular plurals, e.g. mice, sheep.

9CA775E607AF46CC8D117093DBA4DEAB.description: Relate rhyme to known spelling patterns, e.g. whale, snail.

B17D63BA6DB0480F8BBE5134EA7E2428.description:
Explore and use spellings of words with split digraphs, e.g. made,
like.

7D07E4D5833842689F6EDB891AEC1C95.description: Explore and use different spellings of common phonemes, including long vowel phonemes, e.g. day, rain, made, great; apple, travel, metal.

510E85B73C814FE2B4DF306095E86209.description: Recognise that stories may be from different times and places.

8FA5936E20E144F3BF2749BB9338BD25.description: Make choices about books to read for pleasure.

F096B3B14DAB4695AE53F1E50499AC1C.description:
Discuss texts read or heard, including giving reasons for likes and
dislikes

B61C9BBA66244CDF8840D2885669D730.description: Begin to read texts silently as well as aloud.

287644EB24B749E0A39CBEF769E55295.description: Enjoy reading and hearing a range of simple stories, poems and non-fiction texts.

97BAF92955DE486CA0310727F4A80450.description:
Talk about patterns in simple stories and poems, e.g. rhyme,
repetition.

09A931ABD8E64C139B9C97B78D132087.description: Answer questions about texts with some explanation of thinking.

1207D79758D54A45BD94558197E26052.description:
Locate relevant information in texts, including using a contents
page.

CA2D618129CE471588258ED8C71C4CC8.description: Answer simple questions from reading a short text.

BD51C57F45DB471EAEC23266F2BA97AE.description: Make simple inferences based on what is said or done in a text

C1125DF87A684187B42BC38E86C25D3B.description: Explore implicit meanings in simple texts.

2D40E485186E4FC58BA2838EA9566763.description:
Find information from simple visual sources, including tables and
labelled diagrams.

07D0F4046ECF4F7FACE66A9191531813.description: Identify and use the main events to retell a story verbally.

8BFD68F0920D4ADF8BD6F1C23CCEB20A.description: Explore explicit meanings in simple texts.

790E277437774387A129B14A4CF4CD33.description: Begin to show awareness that different non-fiction text types have different purposes and begin to identify their features.

B183C0312A074F95A9C3C236CC3B84D1.description: Read and explore a range of simple non-fiction text types

A6A462EC37284919979C32718D58A5B9.description: Identify the characteristics of simple stories.

18B89D2992424419B3E02E5086EC4D8C.description: Read and explore a range of simple stories and poems, including identifying the contribution of any visual elements

558E836EAA894B5697434A7EACCF890D.description: Begin to distinguish between fiction and non-fiction texts

17CFE2BCC3B24875A84C7ADA622A8C83.description:
Explore and recognise organisational features that help the reader
to find information in texts, including subheadings and labelled diagrams.

077220835C0449A88923BC08F201E27C.description:
Explore and recognise the features of text structure in a range of
different fiction and non-fiction texts, including simple poems.

B5613E30A6DB4A01957744FFEEA91DC3.description: Talk about the sequence of events or ideas in a text.

DC6B8FE3145943D8A330F344C9667CCB.description:
Explore examples of pronouns in texts, including their purpose and
how they agree grammatically with verbs.

8661EDD19B144D56AAEF5CAD8D3EC36B.description:
Explore in texts examples of nouns and noun phrases, including use
of common adjectives and simple quantifiers (e.g. some, most, all).

4BF28FE62290402E864AAFF659A72397.description: Explore in texts, and understand, the grammar of commands/instructions and questions.

1951613643314D68A870A3B5E627A382.description: Explore in texts sentences that contain and, but, because, if, when.

1D49CD8040E64A909C9465C2A8AF62E4.description:
Explore in texts, and understand, the differences in use of full stops
and question marks.

73138D92E44E458A8A8C58BB24F2449A.description:
Show understanding of punctuation, including speech marks, and
simple grammar when re-reading text.

5040C95388CA425F93C058C7D304F63F.description:
Explore different ways of beginning sentences in texts, including
using language of time.

4C953EC88F734D6087B5A397D427533F.description:
Explore and comment on sounds and words in texts, including
adjectives.

35337F12657845E18B30A9946CF520E1.description:
Use the initial letter to organise words in alphabetical order, and to
locate words in simple dictionaries and glossaries.

1AD51B34F4A148D1B2ECE4FC5022A283.description:
Identify and record interesting and significant words from texts to
inform own writing.

DB2B9BFF6CCB470EA4999E310285EA5A.description: Identify possible meanings of unfamiliar words encountered in reading

6164D85FD7A04DA5AD871DEC21414417.description: Read multi-syllabic and compound words by segmenting them into syllables.

A1810F89961848A9BC5B73BED4EEE5CD.description: Use phonic knowledge to decode unfamiliar words.

95B57D4ABC4D442DA24E8247FD125BB7.description: Read familiar words quickly and accurately, usually without audible sounding and blending

CA16210F29264176B009C68ED833800B.description: Read words with common prefixes and suffixes, including un-, dis-, re-, -er, -est, -ly, -y and -ful.

4F983781D4CD41FA85E86909CF2A8D31.description: Read words with split digraphs, e.g. made, like

3B16E0FB00784F5EA6648D707EB1DF44.description: Identify common ways in which graphemes can be pronounced differently, e.g. how and low; hot and cold.
